thread.title: JUI-F leader shot dead in Charsadda
thread.title_full: JUI-F leader shot dead in Charsadda

author: Mureeb Mohmand
title: JUI-F leader shot dead in Charsadda
text:
Share Tweet Email 
SHABQADAR: The chief of the local chapter of the Khatm-e-Nabuwat Movement (an anti-Ahmadi movement) and JUI-F leader was killed by unidentified motorcyclist near his home in Charsadda. 
Police officials termed the incident a case of targeted killing and said that Haji Kaleemullah was killed near his home in the Prang area. They said that the JUI-F man was lured out of his home before being shot dead. 
JUI-F seminary sealed in Charsadda 
The assailant fled after committing the murder. The body of the deceased was later brought to the DHQ hospital, where a large number of JUI-F workers also gathered. 
JUI-F MNA Gauhar Shah termed the killing a terrorist act and called for immediate arrest of the culprits involved in the incident. He warned that if this was not done, his party would launch an agitation campaign. 
JUI-F leader allegedly assaults woman rights activist on TV show 
Also on Sunday, JUI-F workers staged a protest in the main Shabqadar Chowk against the arrest of their workers and closure of the seminary run by a local JUI-F leader in Tangi. 
The protest demonstration was later addressed by the provincial chief of the JUI-F Maulana Gul Naseeb Khan and general secretary Maulana Shujaul Mulk.
